question: What is Regent Seven Seas Cruises?
answer: Regent Seven Seas Cruises (RSSC) is a luxury cruise line known for offering an all-inclusive luxury experience that is unrivaled in the industry:contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}. Often marketed as "The World's Most Luxurious Fleet®," Regent provides comprehensive included luxuries on every voyage – from spacious oceanview suites (most with private balconies) and personalized service, to unlimited shore excursions, fine dining (including specialty restaurants), unlimited beverages (fine wines, spirits, specialty coffees, etc.), prepaid gratuities, unlimited Wi-Fi, and more, all included in the cruise fare:contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}:contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}.

question: How can I contact Regent Seven Seas Cruises customer service?
answer: You can contact Regent Seven Seas Cruises' reservations team by phone at 1-866-585-0942 (or 800-285-1835). Their call center hours of operation are weekdays 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM Eastern Time, Saturday and Sunday 9:30 AM – 5:30 PM ET:contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}:contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}. You may also request a call back or submit an inquiry via forms on their website:contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}.

question: What is included in the cruise fare?
answer: Regent Seven Seas cruises are all-inclusive. The fare covers virtually everything on board: unlimited shore excursions in every port, all fine dining (including specialty restaurants) with no additional charges, unlimited beverages including premium wines and spirits, open bars and lounges, in-suite mini-bar replenished daily, complimentary Wi-Fi throughout the ship, pre-paid gratuities (tips), 24-hour room service, and even valet laundry service on all voyages:contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}:contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}. Additionally, all suites are ocean-view (nearly all with private balconies), and Penthouse-level (and above) suites include butler service for added personal attention:contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}.

question: When are deposits and final payments due for a booking?
answer: The required deposit and final payment schedule depends on the sailing date and length of the cruise. For bookings made after January 1, 2025, on voyages 60 nights or less: a 15% deposit (25% for the Regent Suite) is due within 5 days of booking if booked more than 150 days before sailing, with final payment due 150 days prior to departure:contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}. If booking closer in (e.g. 120–91 days prior, etc.), full payment is required sooner (within 5 days, 3 days, 24 hours, or even same-day for last-minute bookings):contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}. For longer cruises (61 nights or more), the schedule includes a 10% initial deposit (25% for Regent Suite) due within 5 days, with an additional deposit to reach 30% by 180 days out, and final payment due 180 days before sailing:contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}.

question: What is the cancellation policy if I need to cancel my cruise?
answer: Regent Seven Seas Cruises has a tiered cancellation fee schedule based on how far in advance of the sailing you cancel. All cancellation notices must be in writing and received by Regent before the penalty period begins:contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12}. For example, for cruises 14 nights or less: cancelling 121 days or more before departure typically incurs a $100 per person administrative fee in certain suite categories:contentReference[oaicite:13]{index=13}. Cancelling 120–91 days prior to the cruise results in a 50% cancellation fee (15% for lower suite categories):contentReference[oaicite:14]{index=14}. At 90–61 days out, the penalty increases to 75% of the fare (50% for some categories):contentReference[oaicite:15]{index=15}. Within 60–31 days of departure, the penalty is 100% of fare for higher suites and 75% for suite categories SG-H:contentReference[oaicite:16]{index=16}. Cancelling 30 days or less prior (or failing to show up) results in a 100% forfeiture of the fare for all guests:contentReference[oaicite:17]{index=17}. (Longer voyages have similar tiered schedules with slightly different day ranges:contentReference[oaicite:18]{index=18}.)

question: Are there any age restrictions or policies for infants, children, or pregnant guests?
answer: Yes. Regent Seven Seas Cruises cannot accept any guest who will have entered their 24th week of pregnancy by the beginning of or at any time during the cruise:contentReference[oaicite:19]{index=19}. Infants must be at least 6 months old to sail (and at least 1 year old if the itinerary has three or more consecutive days at sea):contentReference[oaicite:20]{index=20}. Any guest under 18 years of age must be accompanied by an adult and occupy the same suite; minors cannot sail unaccompanied:contentReference[oaicite:21]{index=21}. (Regent does not provide childcare or babysitting services on board:contentReference[oaicite:22]{index=22}.) Guests traveling with an infant who does not meet the minimum age will be denied boarding with no refund or compensation:contentReference[oaicite:23]{index=23}.

question: Can I book my cruise online?
answer: Yes. Regent allows guests to book cruises online. You can select a voyage on the website and use the "Plan My Cruise" link next to the sailing you are interested in to complete an online booking:contentReference[oaicite:24]{index=24}. (Alternatively, you may also book through a travel advisor or by calling Regent's reservations center.)

question: Do you offer any benefits or discounts for group travel?
answer: Yes, Regent Seven Seas Cruises offers group travel benefits. They note that nothing beats traveling the world with a group of like-minded companions and enjoying shared discoveries together:contentReference[oaicite:25]{index=25}. Special group arrangements or benefits can be arranged by contacting Regent or your travel advisor. (Regent provides information on group booking benefits on their website:contentReference[oaicite:26]{index=26}.)

question: Do you offer hotel stays or land programs before or after the cruise?
answer: Yes. Regent Seven Seas Cruises offers optional pre- and post-cruise hotel programs and land packages. You can extend your stay in the embarkation or debarkation city (or enjoy multi-night overland programs) by purchasing these packages:contentReference[oaicite:27]{index=27}. The programs typically include hotel accommodations (in luxury hotels), taxes, service charges, full breakfast, porterage, and transfers between the hotel and ship as applicable:contentReference[oaicite:28]{index=28}. (Note: early check-in or late check-out at hotels is not included unless you purchase an extra night.) Regent may substitute hotels if necessary. Some land programs require a minimum number of participants and could be canceled if that number isn't met (cancellation penalties apply for land programs canceled within 90 days of departure):contentReference[oaicite:29]{index=29}. Guests who book their flights through Regent's Air/Sea Program will receive transfers to/from the ship or hotel; guests with independent air can purchase private transfers if desired:contentReference[oaicite:30]{index=30}.

question: Do Regent ships have wheelchair accessible suites?
answer: Yes, Regent Seven Seas Cruises ships offer wheelchair-accessible suites for guests with disabilities. Details about the accessible suites (including layout and amenities) can be found on Regent's website:contentReference[oaicite:31]{index=31}. Additionally, Regent has an arrangement with a mobility equipment provider, Scootaround, for guests who may need to rent wheelchairs or mobility scooters during the cruise. Scootaround can be contacted toll-free at 1-888-441-7575 for assistance with rentals:contentReference[oaicite:32]{index=32}.

question: How should I plan and book my cruise vacation?
answer: Regent strongly recommends using the services of a professional travel agent to plan and book your cruise:contentReference[oaicite:33]{index=33}. A travel advisor is best qualified to assist with all your travel needs, including selecting the perfect voyage, arranging flights or pre/post-cruise arrangements, and ensuring you get any applicable promotions or benefits. Of course, you may also contact Regent directly, but leveraging a knowledgeable travel agent is advised for the best experience:contentReference[oaicite:34]{index=34}.

question: Where can I find the day-to-day itinerary for a cruise?
answer: Detailed day-by-day itineraries for each voyage are available on Regent's website. Simply navigate to the page of the specific cruise you're interested in — the itineraries can be found under the "Overview" tab of each voyage's information page:contentReference[oaicite:35]{index=35}. This will show the schedule of ports and sea days for each day of the cruise.

question: What items am I not allowed to bring on board?
answer: For the safety and comfort of all guests, Regent Seven Seas prohibits certain items from being brought on board. Banned items include weapons of any kind (firearms, replicas, ammunition, knives with blades longer than 4 inches, martial arts weapons, etc.):contentReference[oaicite:36]{index=36}:contentReference[oaicite:37]{index=37}, explosives or incendiaries (fireworks, flares, explosive chemicals):contentReference[oaicite:38]{index=38}, illegal drugs or narcotics (including marijuana, even if for medical use):contentReference[oaicite:39]{index=39}, and any kind of remotely controlled aerial devices like drones:contentReference[oaicite:40]{index=40}:contentReference[oaicite:41]{index=41}. Other prohibited items are irons, ironing boards or steamers (anything with a heating element), "hoverboard"-type scooters, large batteries (aside from mobility scooter batteries), and similar hazardous items:contentReference[oaicite:42]{index=42}:contentReference[oaicite:43]{index=43}. Note that service animals are permitted with advance notice, but pets or other animals are not allowed onboard (aside from approved guide/service animals):contentReference[oaicite:44]{index=44}.

question: Is there a limit on how much luggage I can bring?
answer: Regent Seven Seas Cruises does not impose a strict limit on the amount of personal luggage you can bring on board their ships; however, airlines do have baggage limitations that you should consider for your flights:contentReference[oaicite:45]{index=45}. A typical guideline often followed is two checked bags per person. Generally, each checked bag should not exceed 50–70 lbs in weight, and the total dimensions (length + width + height) should be within about 62 inches (158 cm) per bag:contentReference[oaicite:46]{index=46}. It’s always a good idea to verify your airline's specific baggage allowances, as those will be the limiting factor.

question: What is the dress code on a Regent Seven Seas cruise?
answer: Attire on Regent Seven Seas cruises is elegant yet relaxed. During the day (before 6 p.m.), casual resort-style clothing is appropriate throughout the ship:contentReference[oaicite:47]{index=47}. In the evenings after 6 p.m., the dress code is "Elegant Casual." For women, this includes skirts, slacks, or nice jeans (that are not torn or distressed) paired with blouses, sweaters, or dresses; for men, slacks or non-distressed jeans with collared shirts (jackets are optional) are appropriate:contentReference[oaicite:48]{index=48}. In practice, many guests opt for a dress, blouse and pants, or even gowns for ladies, and jackets or suits for gentlemen are welcome but not required:contentReference[oaicite:49]{index=49}. Note that items like shorts, t-shirts, baseball caps, flip-flops, and bathrobes are not considered appropriate in public areas after 6 p.m.:contentReference[oaicite:50]{index=50}. (On the final night of the voyage, the evening dress code is relaxed to casual, recognizing guests may be packing for departure):contentReference[oaicite:51]{index=51}.

question: Do I need a passport or visa to sail with Regent Seven Seas Cruises?
answer: Yes, all travelers are required to carry a valid passport when cruising with Regent Seven Seas, regardless of the itinerary or their nationality:contentReference[oaicite:52]{index=52}. Passports should be valid for at least 6 months beyond the end of the cruise:contentReference[oaicite:53]{index=53}. A passport book is required – passport cards or photocopies are not accepted:contentReference[oaicite:54]{index=54}. In addition to a passport, you must secure any necessary visas for the countries on your itinerary. Visa requirements vary by destination; Regent advises guests to check approximately 90 days before sailing to determine which visas may be needed:contentReference[oaicite:55]{index=55}. It is each guest’s responsibility to obtain all required visas and travel documents prior to embarkation:contentReference[oaicite:56]{index=56}. (For example, certain nationalities may require a Canadian visa for cruises that visit Canada, etc., and guests will be denied boarding if proper visas are not acquired:contentReference[oaicite:57]{index=57}.)

question: What if I have special dietary requirements or food allergies?
answer: Regent Seven Seas Cruises can accommodate many special dietary needs, but they request advance notice. Guests with strict dietary requirements (for example, medical diets, severe food allergies, or requests for kosher meals) should inform Regent at least 120 days before sailing for cruises departing from the U.S. (150 days prior for voyages embarking elsewhere):contentReference[oaicite:58]{index=58}. You can send your dietary requests via email to specialrequests@rssc.com:contentReference[oaicite:59]{index=59}. Standard dietary preferences (low-salt, low-cholesterol, vegetarian, etc.) can typically be met on board by speaking with the dining staff once you are on the ship:contentReference[oaicite:60]{index=60}. Providing advance notice ensures the ship can stock necessary foods or make special arrangements to meet your needs.

question: What if I'm celebrating a special occasion during my cruise?
answer: If you will be celebrating a birthday, anniversary, honeymoon, or any special occasion while on board, Regent Seven Seas Cruises would be delighted to celebrate with you. You should indicate the special occasion on your Guest Registration Form prior to your cruise:contentReference[oaicite:61]{index=61}. By advising Regent in advance, the crew can prepare to acknowledge your celebration (for example, with a cake or celebratory gesture during your voyage). More details on how Regent can help celebrate special occasions are available on their website:contentReference[oaicite:62]{index=62}.
